ACT
69
Necessary heirs
Article 69
Necessary heirs are the decedent's descendants, his adopted children and their descendants, and his spouse.
The testator's parents, adoptive parents and other ancestors are necessary heirs only if they are permanently unable to work and do not have the necessary means of subsistence.
The persons referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 of this article are necessary heirs when they are called to inherit according to the legal order of inheritance.
